sentences.english: But it was also a bold attack on feudalism and arranged marriage.
sentences.chinese: 但它同時也是對封建制度和包辦婚姻的一記猛擊。

sentences.english: If threatened, the colo will lash out with amazing speed.
sentences.chinese: 在受到威脅時，寇羅爪魚會以驚人的速度發出猛擊。

sentences.english: A punch like that would double up anyone.
sentences.chinese: 像那樣的猛擊會使任何人彎下腰來。

sentences.english: Bashed him with my elbow after that until he fell through my arms into a heap at my feet.
sentences.chinese: 接着用我的手肘猛擊他直到他癱軟在我的腳下。

sentences.english: They bastinadoed him on the head.
sentences.chinese: 他們對他頭部連續猛擊。

sentences.english: Bob teed off on the new pitcher's first delivery.
sentences.chinese: 鮑勃猛擊那新投手所投的第一個球。

sentences.english: He peppered the ball across the green.
sentences.chinese: 他一下子把球猛擊過草地。

sentences.english: The angry lawyer smashed his fists against the desk.
sentences.chinese: 憤怒的律師用拳頭猛擊桌子。

sentences.english: The beginner must practice constantly, aiming chops and jabs at an imaginary partner.
sentences.chinese: 初學者必需堅持不懈的練習，瞄準假想對手不斷猛擊。

sentences.english: Heaving forward, I snapped my elbow across his jaw and grabbed the gun as he fell back.
sentences.chinese: 我撲上去用肘猛擊他的下巴，在他倒下時抓住槍。

sentences.english: Melrose reared his arm back to strike, then burst into laughter.
sentences.chinese: 麥羅斯向後揮着手臂猛擊，然後哈哈大笑起來。

sentences.english: Their strategic feints and jabs at each other are the ones that matter now.
sentences.chinese: 現在重要的是它們相互之間戰略性的佯攻和猛擊。

sentences.english: Jack duked me because he said I had insulted him.
sentences.chinese: 傑克用拳猛擊我，因爲他說我侮辱了他。

sentences.english: His mind blanked out as he was hit hard and lost consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 當他被猛擊失去知覺時，頭腦中完全是一片空白。

sentences.english: He wanted to crack the rowdy over the head, but refrained.
sentences.chinese: 他想猛擊小流氓的頭，可還是忍住了。

sentences.english: Shield Slam is now available to all warriors, starting at level 40.
sentences.chinese: 盾牌猛擊40級時能從技能訓練師處習得。

definition: child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to whisper to one another's ear
extraordinary strength/super strong/strong as an ox
to form a scar/to form a scab
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
